items.name: ruby
items.short_description: Ruby is a scripting language designed for simplified object-oriented programming.
items.description: Ruby was developed by Yukihiro "Matz" Matsumoto in 1995 with the intent of having an easily readable programming language. It is integrated with the Rails framework to create dynamic web-applications. Ruby's syntax is similar to that of Perl and Python.

text_matches.fragment: Ruby is a scripting language designed for simplified object-oriented programming.

Ruby was developed by Yukihiro "Matz" Matsumoto in 1995 with the intent of having an easily readable programming language. It is integrated with the Rails framework to create dynamic web-applications. Ruby's syntax is similar to that of Perl and Python.

items.name: rails
items.short_description: Ruby on Rails (Rails) is a web application framework written in Ruby.
items.description: Ruby on Rails (Rails) is a web application framework written in Ruby. It is meant to help simplify the building of complex websites.

text_matches.fragment: Ruby on Rails (Rails) is a web application framework written in Ruby.
Ruby on Rails (Rails) is a web application framework written in Ruby. It is meant to help simplify the building of complex websites.

items.name: python
items.short_description: Python is a dynamically typed programming language.
items.description: Python is a dynamically typed programming language designed by Guido Van Rossum. Much like the programming language Ruby, Python was designed to be easily read by programmers. Because of its large following and many libraries, Python can be implemented and used to do anything from webpages to scientific research.

items.name: jekyll
items.short_description: Jekyll is a simple, blog-aware static site generator.
items.description: Jekyll is a blog-aware, site generator written in Ruby. It takes raw text files, runs it through a renderer and produces a publishable static website.

text_matches.fragment: Jekyll is a blog-aware, site generator written in Ruby. It takes raw text files, runs it through a renderer and produces a publishable static website.

items.name: sass
items.short_description: Sass is a stable extension to classic CSS.
items.description: Sass is a stylesheet language with a main implementation in Ruby. It is an extension of CSS that makes improvements to the old stylesheet format, such as being able to declare variables and using a cleaner nesting syntax.
items.created_by: Hampton Catlin, Natalie Weizenbaum, Chris Eppstein

text_matches.fragment: Sass is a stylesheet language with a main implementation in Ruby. It is an extension of CSS that makes improvements to the old stylesheet format, such as being able to declare variables and using a cleaner nesting syntax.

items.name: homebrew
items.short_description: Homebrew is a package manager for macOS.
items.description: Homebrew is a package manager for Apple's macOS operating system. It simplifies the installation of software and is popular in the Ruby on Rails community.

text_matches.fragment: Homebrew is a package manager for Apple's macOS operating system. It simplifies the installation of software and is popular in the Ruby on Rails community.
